doc.repnme: Defying the passage of time : the experience of managing water and sanitation services in four small cities of Peru
doc.abstracts: This paper stresses that in the cases studied, it can be concluded that after five years of operation with operators who were hired by their respective municipalities, for management of water and sanitation, there are generally some progress linked to quality of service and business management, to varying degree, depending on the case. But there are still important goals of outstanding work, with priority, increasing operating hours per day and the significant increase in coverage of sewerage and sewage treatment, so that a comprehensive improvement is achieved for existing water and sanitation services, consolidating management models applied in each case. In two of the cases studied (Sechura and Tumbes) in which were defined annual goals, the level of compliance achieved in a number of program goals (e.g. metering levels and coverage of sewerage and wastewater) is markedly different from the levels that were programmed, so it is required that goals are reviewed, realistically, depending on the actual capacity of the potential resources available for investments. Successful delegation models of Operators of Specialized Services (OES), depend significantly on the resources to allocate municipalities or obtain and execute projects of investment required, which, in a way, is a weakness, as a factor that cannot handle Operators.
